title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: norman package specialized R tool designed Department Statistics University Warwick generate comprehensive PDF reports analyzing module examination marks. package implements robust statistical methodology based median differences identify “module effects” (relative difficulty across modules) accounting varying student abilities, enabling fair comparisons across different courses taken overlapping student cohorts.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: print_path(folder) Returns displays full absolute path specified folder, formatting hierarchical structure readability reports. print_file_listing(folder) Scans folder CSV files returns formatted table showing filenames last modification timestamps, providing audit trail information data sources used report. check_modules_expected(working_directory, module_codes) Validates marks data expected module list reading modules_expected_here.txt identifying unexpected extra modules missing expected modules, helping catch data errors early.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: meddiff(xmat, threshold = 5) Computes matrix pairwise median within-student differences module pairs. pair modules, calculates median mark differences across students took modules, requiring least threshold students valid comparison. forms foundation module effects analysis. meddiff_for_display(xmat, threshold = 5) Produces display-oriented version median differences, formatting results list module shows comparisons modules along student counts, optimized inclusion report tables. meddiff_fit(m) Fits weighted least-squares linear model median differences matrix extract module effects. estimates single difficulty parameter module best explains pairwise median differences, weights proportional number student pairs underlying median. get_module_effects(module_codes, mdd) Extracts formats fitted module effects model, centering around median (setting zero) creating ranked table showing relative difficulty easiest hardest, along count comparisons available module. print_module_effect(module_code, mdf) Retrieves module effect specific module formats human-readable string (e.g., “plus 5.2” “minus 3.7”) inclusion individual module reports. list_all_median_differences(mdd) Prints comprehensive listing computed median differences module pairs, organized module, providing complete transparency underlying data used module effects calculation.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: raw_mark_summaries(marks_matrix) Computes eight-number summary module including sample size, number zeros, quartiles, maximum, mean, standard deviation, providing comprehensive overview mark distribution module. raw_mark_classes(marks_matrix, dp = 0) Calculates percentage students falling UK degree classification range (zero, 1-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70+) every module, revealing marks distribute across conventional performance categories.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: stemleaf(module_code, module_marks) Generates stem--leaf plot specific module’s marks, providing compact visual representation distribution preserves actual data values, useful quickly identifying patterns outliers. scatter(module_code, marks_matrix, student_overall_median, has_groups) Creates ggplot2 scatterplot comparing student’s mark specific module overall median mark across modules taken. Points diagonal line indicate better--expected performance; points indicate worse--expected performance. has_groups = TRUE optional grouping CSV files present, plot uses color coding colorblind-safe Okabe-Ito palette distinguish student groups defined student_course.csv course_mappings.csv. has_groups = FALSE, creates simple grayscale scatterplot.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: make_module_pages(working_directory, module_codes, module_names, keep_tmpdir = FALSE) master function orchestrates individual module report generation. reads module-specific R Markdown template, customizes module substituting module codes names, renders template using knitr::knit_child(), returns compiled R Markdown content ready inclusion final PDF document.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: save_history(summaries, mdf, working_directory) Saves eight-number summaries module effects history.csv file longitudinal tracking module statistics across academic years. function reads current year year.txt file (must contain single line year 1000-2999), creates history file doesn’t exist, appends new rows module columns: Year, Module, (N), Zeros, Min., 1st Qu., Median, 3rd Qu., Max., Mean, S.D., Effect. data current year already exists, user prompted via interactive menu choose whether overwrite cancel. function enables tracking module performance trends time. n_recent_years(history, n) Filters history dataframe return n recent years data, using dplyr::dense_rank() handle year ordering. useful focusing visualizations recent trends maintaining access full historical record. history_boxplot(history) Creates ggplot2 boxplot visualization showing distribution marks across years specific module. Uses five-number summary statistics (Min., 1st Qu., Median, 3rd Qu., Max.) history data reconstruct boxplots year, providing visual representation mark distributions changed time. plot titled “Mark distribution year, summary statistics”. history_effects(history) Creates ggplot2 line plot showing trend module effects time specific module. Uses scales::breaks_width() ensure appropriate year-based axis breaks. plot titled “History module effects” allows examination boards identify whether module’s relative difficulty stable changed systematically time.

previous_headings: Core Functions
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: update(build_opts = "---build-vignettes", ...) Provides convenient wrapper around remotes::install_github() updating norman package latest version GitHub repository, simplifying package maintenance users.

what: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: norman package follows structured workflow transform raw CSV mark files comprehensive analytical report:

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: process begins user creates R Markdown document norman template (skeleton.Rmd). template references report_body_material.Rmd, orchestrates entire analysis. system first calls print_path() print_file_listing() document data sources, reads CSV files marks/ subfolder, extracting sprCode (student identifier) overallMark columns. Module codes determined taking first 5 characters CSV filename. individual module mark files consolidated single marks_matrix rows represent students columns represent modules, NA values module-student combinations student take module. system also checks optional grouping files (student_course.csv course_mappings.csv) enable color-coded scatterplots student group. present, files validated ensure correct column names: student_course.csv must columns “ID” “Course”, course_mappings.csv must columns “Course” “Group”. has_groups flag set based whether files exist pass validation.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: analysis begins, check_modules_expected() validates marks data matches expectations comparing found modules modules_expected_here.txt file, system verifies module codes corresponding names module_names.csv. discrepancies prominently reported top document alert users potential data issues.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: report provides comprehensive overview modules. raw_mark_summaries() generates traditional statistical summaries (quartiles, means, standard deviations), raw_mark_classes() shows distribution across UK degree classification boundaries. tables allow quick identification modules unusual mark distributions diving comparative analysis.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: analytical heart package. process: Calls meddiff() compute pairwise median differences modules based students took modules pair Calls meddiff_fit() fit least-squares model finds single “module effect” parameter module best explains median differences Uses get_module_effects() extract rank effects easiest hardest, centered around median zero Generates Q-Q plot assess whether distribution module effects consistent natural variation (normally distributed) contains outliers deserving special attention Calls list_all_median_differences() provide complete transparency printing every pairwise comparison underlying fitted effects methodology robust simple mean comparisons uses medians (resistant outliers) leverages within-student differences (controlling overall student ability differences across cohorts).

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: final section creates detailed page module landscape orientation. make_module_pages(): Reads module-template.Rmd template file module, creates customized copy substituting actual module code name Saves temporary directory Renders using knitr::knit_child() Collects rendered output single character vector individual module page combines multiple visualizations statistics: scatter() creates scatterplot showing student’s mark module compares overall median performance, optional color-coding student group stemleaf() provides stem--leaf display raw mark distribution print_module_effect() reports fitted module effect human-readable form Selected rows raw_mark_summaries() raw_mark_classes() tables show module’s statistics historical data exists module history.csv, additional landscape page created showing: history_boxplot() displaying mark distributions 5 recent years history_effects() showing trend module effects time history visualizations positioned side--side page using \vspace positioning, boxplot left effects plot right. system filters module-specific history using n_recent_years() focus 5 recent years data.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: main R Markdown document uses knitr execute code chunks sequence, assembling: Title page report metadata, author, remarks Data source documentation Data validation results Overall summary tables modules Module effects analysis rankings Q-Q plot Complete listing median differences Individual module pages (one per module landscape) module history data: additional landscape page historical visualizations final knit operation converts R Markdown document PDF via LaTeX, producing publication-ready report suitable examination board meetings scaling committee decisions.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: generating report, users can call save_history() archive current year’s statistics history.csv. function requires year.txt file working directory containing academic year. accumulated history enables longitudinal analysis future reports, allowing examination boards monitor trends module difficulty mark distributions multiple years. supports evidence-based decisions module design, assessment difficulty, stability scaling adjustments.

previous_headings: How the Report Generation Process Works
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: package embodies several key design principles: Reproducibility: data sources timestamps documented Transparency: statistical methods raw data exposed report Robustness: Median-based methods resist influence outliers small numbers unusual marks Fairness: Within-student comparisons control ability differences across cohorts Usability: Template-based approach requires minimal R knowledge users Auditability: Validation checks catch common data errors early Flexibility: External CSV-based grouping system allows customization without code changes Longitudinal awareness: History tracking enables trend analysis across academic years Accessibility: Colorblind-safe palettes ensure visualizations readable users architecture enables statistics administrators generate standardized, rigorous analytical reports minimal manual intervention maintaining full transparency methodology underlying data.

title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: norman package expects following file structure working directory:

previous_headings: Expected Data Files
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: marks/ folder: Contains CSV files module marks - Filenames: First 5 characters used module code (e.g., ST123_marks.csv → module code “ST123”) - Required columns: sprCode (student identifier), overallMark (numeric mark) module_names.csv: Maps module codes human-readable names - Required columns: ModuleCode, ModuleNames (similar) - Used throughout report display full module titles modules_expected_here.txt: Lists expected module codes validation - One module code per line - Used check_modules_expected() identify missing unexpected modules

previous_headings: Expected Data Files
title: norman: Warwick Statistics Module Marks Analysis Package
text: year.txt: Contains academic year history tracking - Single line 4-digit year 1000-2999 - Required save_history() function history.csv: Historical module statistics (created automatically save_history()) - Columns: Year, Module, (N), Zeros, Min., 1st Qu., Median, 3rd Qu., Max., Mean, S.D., Effect - Enables longitudinal visualizations module pages student_course.csv: Maps students course identifiers grouping - Required columns: ID (character), Course (character) - Enables color-coded scatter plots combined course_mappings.csv course_mappings.csv: Maps course identifiers display groups - Required columns: Course (character), Group (character) - Works student_course.csv enable group-based visualization - Uses colorblind-safe Okabe-Ito palette (supports 7 groups)

text: xmat numeric matrix threshold Numeric scalar, minimum number pairs needed computation median difference

title: Compute a matrix of median differences — meddiff
text: square numeric matrix, size equal number columns xmat

title: Compute a matrix of median differences — meddiff
code: # # Toy example from # https://davidfirth.github.io/blog/2019/04/26/robust-measurement-from-a-2-way-table/ # x <- structure(c(NA, NA, 10, NA, NA, 20, NA, NA, 30, 45, 55, NA, 60, 60, 50),   .Dim = c(3L, 5L), .Dimnames = structure(list(student = c("i", "j", "k"),   module = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E")), .Names = c("student", "module"))) print(x) #>        module #> student  A  B  C  D  E #>       i NA NA NA 45 60 #>       j NA NA NA 55 60 #>       k 10 20 30 NA 50 meddiff(x, threshold = 1) #>    A   B   C  D   E #> A NA -10 -20 NA -40 #> B  1  NA -10 NA -30 #> C  1   1  NA NA -20 #> D  0   0   0 NA -10 #> E  1   1   1  2  NA

what: Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
title: Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
text: Extract module effects median differences

title: Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
text: m numeric matrix median differences computed meddiff

title: Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
text: lm model object

title: Extract module effects from the median differences — meddiff_fit
code: # # Toy example from # https://davidfirth.github.io/blog/2019/04/26/robust-measurement-from-a-2-way-table/ # x <- structure(c(NA, NA, 10, NA, NA, 20, NA, NA, 30, 45, 55, NA, 60, 60, 50),   .Dim = c(3L, 5L), .Dimnames = structure(list(student = c("i", "j", "k"),   module = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E")), .Names = c("student", "module"))) print(x) #>        module #> student  A  B  C  D  E #>       i NA NA NA 45 60 #>       j NA NA NA 55 60 #>       k 10 20 30 NA 50 md <- meddiff(x, threshold = 1) the_fit <- meddiff_fit(md)$coef names(the_fit) <- gsub("^X", "", names(the_fit)) the_fit #>   A   B   C   D   E  #> -40 -30 -20 -10   0

title: A version of meddiff to compute median differences in a different format — meddiff_for_display
code: # # Toy example from # https://davidfirth.github.io/blog/2019/04/26/robust-measurement-from-a-2-way-table/ # x <- structure(c(NA, NA, 10, NA, NA, 20, NA, NA, 30, 45, 55, NA, 60, 60, 50),   .Dim = c(3L, 5L), .Dimnames = structure(list(student = c("i", "j", "k"),   module = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E")), .Names = c("student", "module"))) print(x) #>        module #> student  A  B  C  D  E #>       i NA NA NA 45 60 #>       j NA NA NA 55 60 #>       k 10 20 30 NA 50 meddiff_for_display(x, threshold = 1) #> $A #>                     B   C   E #> Median difference -10 -20 -40 #> Count               1   1   1 #>  #> $B #>                    A   C   E #> Median difference 10 -10 -30 #> Count              1   1   1 #>  #> $C #>                    A  B   E #> Median difference 20 10 -20 #> Count              1  1   1 #>  #> $D #>                     E #> Median difference -10 #> Count               2 #>  #> $E #>                    A  B  C  D #> Median difference 40 30 20 10 #> Count              1  1  1  2 #>

norman 1.1.0 (2020-05-04)
text: Fixed bug meddiff_fit (PR #1, thanks Ella Kaye)

title: norman 1.0.9 (2020-04-30)
text: Tweaks format landscape pages individual modules

title: norman 1.0.8 (2020-04-29)
text: Small improvements .Rmd template (skeleton), aid clarity

title: norman 1.0.7 (2020-04-29)
text: Report pages individual modules now landscape-oriented

title: norman 1.0.6 (2020-04-28)
text: Inserted stringsAsFactors = TRUE calls read.csv() data.frame(), quick fix ensure compatibility new R major release 4.0.0. Fixed couple documentation bugs

title: norman 1.0.5 (2019-06-16)
text: median difference now included based least 5 students Module effects now centred upon median module Re-formatting module-specific pages, facilitate screen projection

title: norman 1.0.4 (2019-06-15)
text: Every report produced now states version norman used

title: norman 1.0.3 (2019-06-06)
text: Class boundaries now work non-integer marks (single decimal place)

title: norman 1.0.2 (2019-05-28)
text: Minor bug fixes Use weighted mean centre module effects

title: norman 1.0.1 (2019-05-06)
text: Initial availability package GitHub
